subject: p12110863
History: COPD and 3 L is located at home, presenting with shortness of breath and decreased oxygen saturation.
Findings: The patient is status post median sternotomy and CABG. The cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are stable with the cardiac silhouette persistently enlarged. Two lead left-sided pacemaker is again seen, unchanged in position. There are slightly low lung volumes and there is persistent mild elevation of the right hemidiaphragm. Slight blunting of the right costophrenic angle is stable. Stable right base scarring is again seen. There is no evidence of pneumothorax. No overt pulmonary edema is seen. There may be mild pulmonary vascular congestion.
Impression: Stable cardiomegaly with possible mild pulmonary vascular congestion, without overt pulmonary edema.
